org.jpws.pwslib.crypto

Interface PwsCipher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlowfishCipher, CipherModeCBC, NullCipher, TwofishCipher

    public interface PwsCipher
    Interface for a cryptographic cipher algorithm as used in PWSLIB. PWSLIB uses block ciphers of different block sizes and operation modi. Implementing classes generally should synchronise the methods of this interface!

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer)
      Decrypts a buffer of data and returns the result in a new buffer.
      byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Decrypts a section of a user data buffer and returns the result in a new buffer.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer)
      Encrypts a buffer of data and returns the result in a new buffer.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Encrypts a section of a user data buffer and returns the result in a new buffer.
      int getBlockSize()
      Returns the blocksize of this cipher or 0 if this cipher is not a block cipher.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The name expression for this cipher for human information.

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer)
        Decrypts a buffer of data and returns the result in a new buffer. Input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - byte[] encrypted data; length must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize
        Returns:
        byte[] decrypted data block (same length as buffer)

      • decrypt

        byte[] decrypt(byte[] buffer,
             int start,
             int length)
        Decrypts a section of a user data buffer and returns the result in a new buffer. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - byte[] encrypted data
        start - int start offset in the buffer
        length - int length of the encrypted section; must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize
        Returns:
        byte[] decrypted data block of length length

      • encrypt

        byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer)
        Encrypts a buffer of data and returns the result in a new buffer. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - byte[] cleartext data; length must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize
        Returns:
        byte[] encrypted data block (same length as buffer)

      • encrypt

        byte[] encrypt(byte[] buffer,
             int start,
             int length)
        Encrypts a section of a user data buffer and returns the result in a new buffer. The input buffer data will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        buffer - byte[] cleartext data
        start - int start offset in the buffer of the source cleartext block
        length - int length of the cleartext block; must be an integer multiple of the cipher's blocksize
        Returns:
        byte[] encrypted data block of length length

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        Returns the blocksize of this cipher or 0 if this cipher is not a block cipher.
        Returns:
        int blocksize

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The name expression for this cipher for human information.
        Returns:
        String cipher name
